```{r}
#b and k for MAM
data <- data.frame(
  y_t = c(1852.5,	1898.3,	1974.7,	2047.8,	2127.9,	2165.2,	2195.4,	2407.3,	2572.4),
  y_t1 = c(1898.3,	1974.7,	2047.8,	2127.9,	2165.2,	2195.4,	2407.3,	2572.4,	2576.1),
  y_t2 = c(1974.7,	2047.8,	2127.9,	2165.2,	2195.4,	2407.3,	2572.4,	2576.1,	2640.8),
  G = c(512.7,	520.3,	525.9,	537.1,	548.7,	559.2,	576.1,	613.5,	624.5)
)

lm_fit <- lm(y_t2 - G ~ y_t1 + y_t, data = data)
summary(lm_fit)
```
```{r}
# a and g for higgs
data <- data.frame(
  t = c(1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
  G = c(512.7,	520.3,	525.9,	537.1,	548.7,	559.2,	576.1,	613.5,	624.5)
)

data$logG <- log(data$G)


lm_fit <- lm(logG ~ t, data = data)
lm_fit
```
```{r}
#b and k for higgs
data <- data.frame(
  y_t = c(1852.5,	1898.3,	1974.7,	2047.8,	2127.9,	2165.2,	2195.4,	2407.3,	2572.4),
  y_t1 = c(1898.3,	1974.7,	2047.8,	2127.9,	2165.2,	2195.4,	2407.3,	2572.4,	2576.1),
  y_t2 = c(1974.7,	2047.8,	2127.9,	2165.2,	2195.4,	2407.3,	2572.4,	2576.1,	2640.8),
  G = c(491.11*(1+0.0254)^2, 491.11*(1+0.0254)^3, 491.11*(1+0.0254)^4,
        491.11*(1+0.0254)^5, 491.11*(1+0.0254)^6, 491.11*(1+0.0254)^7,
        491.11*(1+0.0254)^8, 491.11*(1+0.0254)^9, 491.11*(1+0.0254)^10)
)


lm_fit <- lm(y_t2-G ~ y_t1 + y_t, data = data)

summary(lm_fit)

```
